The shortest lifespan I've seen in a century!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2000 Topics (Year Of The Phoenix): The shortest lifespan I've seen in a century!
By Nate Railsback on Thursday, July 6, 2000 - 12:10 pm:

Okay, when I started to raise my brand-new Hare/Zuum, I was pleasantly surprised. Its first drill (a Speed Drill) ended with it getting a Great and 12 points! From a new-born! I'd never seen anything like that before, and I thought I'd have a good time. It went into maturity a little quickly, but I didn't worry too much- and now, at 2 years and 10 months old, it's starting to dip into old age with its stat gains! I have sent this thing into a total of four tournaments, all of which it has crushed the competition without being touched, and it has never gone on errantry. I've fed it with Milk and then Tablets (which it likes) from birth, and it has never been stressed or fatigued. Why the hell is this thing so short-lived!? I was still a mediocre-at-best trainer and got my Worm-and-then-Beaclon to live out to seven years with tons of errantries, expeditions, and such, and it's listed as having the same lifespan expectancy as a Hare! Something is severely wrong here...

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, July 6, 2000 - 12:15 pm:

Well, hares supposedly have a lifespan of 400 weeks, all total. And the zuum should have given it a boost as well. It sounds a lot like the happening of my first Durahan. The one that dropped off in age at a measley 4y or so, and that's _with_ peaches and bananas. I was scared to raise another Durahan for a long whyile, and I'm _still_ paranoid about magic bananas.

Has anyone else had this problem with critters? Maybe the old legends about the paernts' lifespans having something to do with it is true? Or something else we're missing?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, July 6, 2000 - 12:15 pm:

Was it a combined monster, or from a CD?

By Nate Railsback on Thursday, July 6, 2000 - 03:27 pm:

It was the product of a few generations...
